Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: with three binding-holes, slightly misaligned. The blade has been cleaned of corrosion product. There is superficial pitting on both faces, and a section of the cutting edge has been eroded. The line of the original haft is visible on both faces. There is no obvious sign of wear on the cutting edge. Chased roughly in the centre of one face is a group of four hieroglyphs.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (43)
